alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 15 at 9:27PM PDT until May 19 at 6:12PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. .Warm temperatures may melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon to Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Flooding begins on Customs Road near mile post 6. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM PDT Monday the stage was 18.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Monday afternoon. The river is forecast to fluctate around flood stage through Friday. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
